He actually expected us to believe that, as if we hadn't been wearing these things on the job.  As if we wore them to prevent dust from coming out of our lungs.  As if we didn't know that the vent on an N95 mask is a one-way valve that makes exhaling easy, but forces us to inhale through the fibrous material and thereby trap all sorts of particulates.  As if we didn't know that the number on the label referred to the percentage of stuff it trapped, 95%.  He just flat out lied to us.
